Class CcddFileIOHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • CCDD.CcddFileIOHandler

  • public class CcddFileIOHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    CFS Command & Data Dictionary file I/O handler class

    • Method Detail

      • setHandlers

        protected void setHandlers()
        Set the references to the table type and macro handler classes

      • displayUsersGuide

        protected void displayUsersGuide()
        Display the user's guide. The guide file must be located in the same folder as the .jar file. This command is executed in a separate thread since it may take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update

      • backupDatabaseToFile

        protected void backupDatabaseToFile(boolean doInBackground)
        Backup the currently open project's database to a user-selected file using the pg_dump utility. The backup data is stored in plain text format
        Parameters:
        doInBackground - true to perform the operation in a background process

      • restoreDatabaseFromFile

        protected void restoreDatabaseFromFile()
        Restore a project's database from a user-selected backup file. The backup is a plain text file containing the PostgreSQL commands necessary to rebuild the database

      • importFileInBackground

        protected void importFileInBackground(CcddClassesComponent.FileEnvVar[] dataFile,
                          boolean backupFirst,
                          boolean replaceExisting,
                          boolean appendExistingFields,
                          boolean useExistingFields,
                          boolean openEditor,
                          java.awt.Component parent)
        Import one or more files, creating new tables and optionally replacing existing ones. The file(s) may contain definitions for more than one table. This method is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database method completes execution
        Parameters:
        dataFile - array of files to import
        backupFirst - true to create a backup of the database before importing tables
        replaceExisting - true to replace a table that already exists in the database
        appendExistingFields - true to append the existing data fields for a table (if any) to the imported ones (if any). Only valid when replaceExisting is true
        useExistingFields - true to use an existing data field in place of the imported ones if the field names match. Only valid when replaceExisting and appendExistingFields are true
        openEditor - true to open a table editor for each imported table
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • importFile

        protected boolean importFile(CcddClassesComponent.FileEnvVar[] dataFile,
                 boolean backupFirst,
                 boolean replaceExisting,
                 boolean appendExistingFields,
                 boolean useExistingFields,
                 boolean openEditor,
                 java.awt.Component parent)
        Import one or more files, creating new tables and optionally replacing existing ones. The file(s) may contain definitions for more than one table. This method is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database method completes execution
        Parameters:
        dataFile - array of files to import
        backupFirst - true to create a backup of the database before importing tables
        replaceExisting - true to replace a table that already exists in the database
        appendExistingFields - true to append the existing data fields for a table (if any) to the imported ones (if any). Only valid when replaceExisting is true
        useExistingFields - true to use an existing data field in place of the imported ones if the field names match. Only valid when replaceExisting and appendExistingFields are true
        openEditor - true to open a table editor for each imported table
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true is the import operation completes successfully

      • createTablesFromDefinitions

        private void createTablesFromDefinitions(java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableDefinition> tableDefinitions,
                               boolean replaceExisting,
                               boolean openEditor,
                               java.awt.Component parent)
                                  throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Create one or more data tables from the supplied table definitions
        Parameters:
        tableDefinitions - list of table definitions for the table(s) to create
        replaceExisting - true to replace a table that already exists in the database
        openEditor - true to open a table editor for each imported table
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If the table path name is invalid or the table cannot be created from the table definition

      • createImportedTable

        private boolean createImportedTable(CcddClassesDataTable.TableInformation tableInfo,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> cellData,
                          int numColumns,
                          boolean replaceExisting,
                          boolean openEditor,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> allTables,
                          java.awt.Component parent)
                             throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Create a new data table or replace an existing one and paste the supplied cell data into it
        Parameters:
        tableInfo - table information for the table to create
        cellData - array containing the cell data
        numColumns - number of columns in the table
        replaceExisting - true to replace a table that already exists in the database
        openEditor - true to open a table editor for each imported table
        allTables - list containing the paths and names of all tables
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the table is successfully imported; false if the table is exists and the replaceExisting flag is not true
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - The existing table that the new table replaces cannot be removed, the new table cannot be created, or the data cannot be added to the newly created table

      • importSelectedFileIntoTable

        protected void importSelectedFileIntoTable(CcddTableEditorHandler tableHandler)
        Import the contents of a file selected by the user into the specified existing table
        Parameters:
        tableHandler - reference to the table handler for the table into which to import the data

      • addImportedDataField

        private void addImportedDataField(CcddClassesDataTable.TableDefinition tableDefn,
                        java.lang.String ownerName,
                        boolean useExistingFields)
        Import one or more data fields into a table, appending them to any existing fields. If the imported field already exists then the input flag determines if the existing or imported field is used
        Parameters:
        tableDefn - imported table definition
        ownerName - data field owner name
        useExistingFields - true to replace an existing data field with the imported ones if the field names match

      • exportSelectedTablesInBackground

        protected void exportSelectedTablesInBackground(java.lang.String filePath,
                                    java.lang.String[] tablePaths,
                                    boolean overwriteFile,
                                    boolean singleFile,
                                    boolean replaceMacros,
                                    boolean includeReservedMsgIDs,
                                    boolean includeProjectFields,
                                    boolean includeVariablePaths,
                                    CcddVariableHandler variableHandler,
                                    java.lang.String[] separators,
                                    CcddConstants.FileExtension fileExtn,
                                    CcddConstants.EndianType endianess,
                                    boolean isHeaderBigEndian,
                                    java.lang.String version,
                                    java.lang.String validationStatus,
                                    java.lang.String classification1,
                                    java.lang.String classification2,
                                    java.lang.String classification3,
                                    boolean useExternal,
                                    java.lang.String scriptFileName,
                                    java.awt.Component parent)
        Export the contents of one or more tables selected by the user to one or more files in the specified format. The export file names are based on the table name if each table is stored in a separate file. The user supplied file name is used if multiple tables are stored in a single file. This method is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database method completes execution
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the folder in which to store the exported tables. Includes the name if storing the tables to a single file
        tablePaths - table path for each table to load
        overwriteFile - true to store overwrite an existing file; false skip exporting a table to a file that already exists
        singleFile - true to store multiple tables in a single file; false to store each table in a separate file
        replaceMacros - true to replace macros with their corresponding values; false to leave the macros intact
        includeReservedMsgIDs - true to include the contents of the reserved message ID table in the export file
        includeProjectFields - true to include the project-level data field definitions in the export file
        includeVariablePaths - true to include the variable path for each variable in a structure table, both in application format and using the user-defined separator characters
        variableHandler - variable handler class reference; null if includeVariablePaths is false
        separators - string array containing the variable path separator character(s), show/hide data types flag ('true' or 'false'), and data type/variable name separator character(s); null if includeVariablePaths is false
        fileExtn - file extension type
        endianess - EndianType.BIG_ENDIAN for big endian, EndianType.LITTLE_ENDIAN for little endian
        isHeaderBigEndian - true if the telemetry and command headers are always big endian (e.g., as with CCSDS)
        version - version attribute (XTCE only)
        validationStatus - validation status attribute (XTCE only)
        classification1 - first level classification attribute (XTCE only)
        classification2 - second level classification attribute (XTCE only)
        classification3 - third level classification attribute (XTCE only)
        useExternal - true to use external (script) methods in place of the internal ones (XTCE only)
        scriptFileName - name of the script file containing the external (script) methods (XTCE only); ignored if useExternal is false
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • exportSelectedTables

        protected boolean exportSelectedTables(java.lang.String filePath,
                           java.lang.String[] tablePaths,
                           boolean overwriteFile,
                           boolean singleFile,
                           boolean replaceMacros,
                           boolean includeReservedMsgIDs,
                           boolean includeProjectFields,
                           boolean includeVariablePaths,
                           CcddVariableHandler variableHandler,
                           java.lang.String[] separators,
                           CcddConstants.FileExtension fileExtn,
                           CcddConstants.EndianType endianess,
                           boolean isHeaderBigEndian,
                           java.lang.String version,
                           java.lang.String validationStatus,
                           java.lang.String classification1,
                           java.lang.String classification2,
                           java.lang.String classification3,
                           boolean useExternal,
                           java.lang.String scriptFileName,
                           java.awt.Component parent)
        Export the contents of one or more tables selected by the user to one or more files in the specified format. The export file names are based on the table name if each table is stored in a separate file. The user supplied file name is used if multiple tables are stored in a single file
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the folder in which to store the exported tables. Includes the name if storing the tables to a single file
        tablePaths - table path for each table to load
        overwriteFile - true to store overwrite an existing file; false skip exporting a table to a file that already exists
        singleFile - true to store multiple tables in a single file; false to store each table in a separate file
        replaceMacros - true to replace macros with their corresponding values; false to leave the macros intact
        includeReservedMsgIDs - true to include the contents of the reserved message ID table in the export file
        includeProjectFields - true to include the project-level data field definitions in the export file
        includeVariablePaths - true to include the variable path for each variable in a structure table, both in application format and using the user-defined separator characters
        variableHandler - variable handler class reference; null if includeVariablePaths is false
        separators - string array containing the variable path separator character(s), show/hide data types flag ('true' or 'false'), and data type/variable name separator character(s); null if includeVariablePaths is false
        fileExtn - file extension type
        endianess - EndianType.BIG_ENDIAN for big endian, EndianType.LITTLE_ENDIAN for little endian
        isHeaderBigEndian - true if the telemetry and command headers are always big endian (e.g., as with CCSDS)
        version - version attribute (XTCE only)
        validationStatus - validation status attribute (XTCE only)
        classification1 - first level classification attribute (XTCE only)
        classification2 - second level classification attribute (XTCE only)
        classification3 - third level classification attribute (XTCE only)
        useExternal - true to use external (script) methods in place of the internal ones (XTCE only)
        scriptFileName - name of the script file containing the external (script) methods (XTCE only); ignored if useExternal is false
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the export completes successfully

      • isOverwriteExportFileIfExists

        private boolean isOverwriteExportFileIfExists(CcddClassesComponent.FileEnvVar exportFile,
                                    boolean overwriteFile,
                                    java.awt.Component parent)
        Check if the specified data file exists and isn't empty, and if so, whether or not the user elects to overwrite it
        Parameters:
        exportFile - reference to the file
        overwriteFile - true to overwrite an existing file
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        true if the file doesn't exist, or if it does exist and the user elects to overwrite it; false if the file exists and the user elects not to overwrite it, or if an error occurs deleting the existing file or creating a new one

             java.lang.String pathName,
             boolean hasFileName,
             CcddConstants.ModifiablePathInfo modPath)
        Store the specified file path in the program preferences backing store
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class reference
        pathName - file path
        hasFileName - true if the file path includes a file name. The file name is removed before storing the path
        modPath - ModifiablePathInfo reference for the path being updated
